title: Mesut Ozil looks to earn recall ahead of Arsenal's Europa League clash vs Vitoria
text:

Arsenal outcast Mesut Ozil was seen in discussions with Unai Emery at Arsenal training on Wednesday as he looks to earn a recall ahead of their clash with Vitoria in the Europa League on Thursday.

German playmaker Ozil, the Gunners' highest earner, has played just one Premier League game this season and not featured at all in their two Europa League games.

But Emery has refused to close the door on him returning to the fold and declared he could earn a recall with good performances in training.

He was spotted chatting to the manager in training on Wednesday as Emery's side put in their final preparations ahead of a game which could provide an opportunity for Ozil to impress.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

The Gunners will be without Reiss Nelson against the Portuguese outfit due to a thigh injury but they otherwise have a clean bill of health.

Youngster Emile Smith Rowe, recently sidelined with a head injury suffered in the Carabao Cup against Nottingham Forest last month, was amongst first team training prompting speculation he could feature.

(Image: PA)

Emery's side missed out on the chance to go third in the Premier League table with a 1-0 defeat at Sheffield United on Monday.

It was a below-par performance at Bramall Lane as Arsenal faced criticism over their mentality away from home - and Emery conceded his side missed a "big opportunity" to establish themselves in the top four.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

"In my career it is normal to have, in difficult moments, the criticism of my work, my job and the players," Emery said.

"We need to accept that but the focus is my next match and how we can improve. Really we are at the beginning (of the season).

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

"In the Europa League we have won two matches with very good results. We lost a very big opportunity on Monday to be third in the table, we are now fifth but have another chance on Monday."

Arsenal are in control of their Europa League group after 3-0 and 4-0 wins over Eintracht Frankfurst and Standard Liege respectively.

(Image: PA)

Another victory this week would see them move a step closer to qualification from Group F as they aim to go one better in the competition than their losing effort in the final last year.
description: Arsenal are back in Europa League action on Thursday and Mesut Ozil is pushing to earn a recall from Unai Emery
